intro: Coccothrinax martii, commonly known as the Hispaniola palm, is a flowering plant species native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. Coccothrinax martii is adapted to coastal and dry forest environments, showcasing resilience to salt spray and arid conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in the flora of the Caribbean.
